subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Higher usage limits on GPT-4o compared to free tier; rate limits apply but are not publicly specified as a hard token cap.
5x more usage than the free tier, with a minimum spend of ~$5/month included, equivalent to higher usage caps.
Includes access to Gemini 1.5 Pro (renamed Gemini Advanced) within the Google One subscription with usage caps.

llama_3_1_70b_instruct.note: Pricing is for managed services (e.g., AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI). The model itself is open-source and free to self-host, with only infrastructure costs.

pricing_analysis.trend: The market is undergoing a significant price war, driven by highly efficient, low-cost models from Chinese providers (DeepSeek, Qwen) and the accessibility of powerful open-source models (Llama). This pressure is forcing major Western labs like OpenAI and Anthropic to release more cost-effective flagship models (e.g., GPT-4o) and compete on value. The $20/month subscription tier has emerged as the standard for premium individual access, while enterprise pricing remains high, integrating models into broader productivity suites like Microsoft 365.
